title: Supply Chain Software Tampering
description: A compromised vendor build pushes malicious code into an internally trusted deployment pipeline, affecting production services.
entry_point: Malicious update disguised as a dependency patch for a widely used middleware component

phases.name: Recon
phases.description: Threat actor studies vendor release cadence and introduces a subtle backdoor into a library consumed by the organization.

phases.name: Injection
phases.description: During automated build, the trojanized artifact is signed with a valid certificate and pushed to the artifact registry.

phases.name: Propagation
phases.description: Production deploys pull the compromised artifact, establishing a covert control channel and hooking into telemetry ingestion.

impact.technical: Undetected persistence in production pods and control over telemetry
impact.business: Potential damage to customer trust and regulatory penalties

detection_cues: CI/CD pipeline jobs executed outside maintenance windows
